translated: Axelsson, Paul Rickard, Major, Borås, born on January 25, 1892 in Nårunga, Älvsborg County. Son of merchant Axel Andersson and Emma A. G.  Married to Signe Myhrström, with children Gunvor born in 1922 and Leif born in 1937. Axelsson completed his high school education in Borås in 1912, graduated from officer's school in 1914, attended the General Staff Course in 1922, and the Army Intelligence and Security High Course in 1924-1925. He served as a second lieutenant with the Älvsborg Regiment in 1914, was promoted to lieutenant in 1917, captain in 1929, and major in 1937. He was also with the Älvsborg Reserve Regiment from 1940 and retired from military service in 1947. He was a teacher at SS for several years, became the head teacher there in 1935, and was the division head in 1936. Axelsson owned properties in Borås, Visby, Lidingö, and Råsunda. He received the Order of the Sword, the Royal Patriotic Society's Medal, and the Älvsborg County Shooting Association's Medal, and was involved in sports.
